sunflower afghan block © 2022 nina nicholson for spoonsandhooks com instructions for crib-sized afghan the afghan shown above is made with 20 sunflower blocks and measures 36″ l x 29″ w with border it used the following amounts of loops & threads impeccable yarn ½ skein soft taupe for the sunflower centers 1¼ skeins butterscotch for the sunflower petals 2 skeins clear blue for the block backgrounds connecting the blocks and the border you will need a yarn needle to weave in ends to connect the blocks i used the flat slip_stitch technique you can find many tutorials on youtube or you can use your own preferred technique i wanted to keep the border very simple to keep the focus on the sunflowers so i simply worked 3 rounds of single_crochet for the border i did turn the work round 1 of the border was worked with right side facing round 2 with wrong side facing and round 3 with right side facing again again you can add any border you prefer but keep in mind that a wider or more
